content: it seems to me that now the BLS precompile is rather required for phase1 of eth2, and not really for phase0

author: Deleted User

author: Deleted User
content: otherwise it would be like pushing the cart in front of the horse, so to speak

author: Deleted User
content: I would also suggest to put a "kill-switch" into the phase0 deposit contract, that is removed when the phase0 is deemed to be successfully live. This kill-switch, when activated, makes deposits reversible. I think it will lower the risk of catastrophic failure after the phase0 launch, due to massive user error or some technical problem. It means that the phase 0 launch can be reversed and replayed, if needed

author: Deleted User
content: The kill switch will mitigate large user errors at the launch (the policy of activation can be set forth before the launch), and mostly obviate the need to rush BLS precompile before the phase0 for the purpose of re-validating the deposits on-chain

author: Deleted User
content: It will also make a temporary trust of initial Eth2 validators into the launching team explicit rather than implicit - if you trust the people who launch phase0, and you verified they control the kill-switch removal, you will put your ETH1 into the deposit contract

author: jgm
content:
A BLS precompile would be used in phase 0 to check the validity of some of the data being sent in to the deposit contract, and as such avoid the issue where funds are transferred to the deposit contract but not accepted on the beacon chain.  It isn't required, but would provide a very welcome increase in security.

It has been stated that the current version of BLS12-381 is the one we're going with short of any security issues coming to light (which is always the case) so no changes are expected.

If Ethereum 2 went so badly wrong that it was abandoned entirely I'm sure there would be some serious discussions about what to do about the locked deposits, but I don't think that building for that failure is something that would be necessary, nor inspire much confidence in Ethereum 2 in general.
